recipes.name: Chicken Salad

recipeInfo.description: A fresh and healthy chicken salad packed with protein and flavor. Perfect for a light lunch or dinner.

cookingSteps: Season the chicken breast with salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
Cook the chicken for 6-7 minutes on each side until golden brown and fully cooked.
Remove the chicken from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes, then slice into strips.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, halved cherry tomatoes, and sliced cucumber.
In a small bowl, whisk together remaining olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Add the sliced chicken to the salad, drizzle with dressing, and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately and enjoy your healthy chicken salad!

recipes.name: Grilled Salmon Bowl

recipeInfo.description: Nutritious grilled salmon served over quinoa with fresh vegetables and a tangy dressing. Rich in omega-3 fatty acids.

cookingSteps: Cook quinoa according to package instructions and set aside.
Season salmon with salt, pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil.
Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and cook salmon for 4-5 minutes per side.
While salmon cooks, prepare vegetables: slice avocado, shred cabbage, and cook edamame.
Divide quinoa between two bowls.
Top with grilled salmon, avocado slices, edamame, and red cabbage.
Mix soy sauce with lime juice and drizzle over the bowls.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve warm.

recipes.name: Protein Pancakes

recipeInfo.description: Fluffy protein-packed pancakes perfect for breakfast. High in protein and delicious with your favorite toppings.

cookingSteps: Mash the banana in a large bowl until smooth.
Add eggs, almond milk, and vanilla extract to the bowl and whisk together.
In a separate bowl, mix protein powder, oat flour, and baking powder.
Combine wet and dry ingredients and mix until just combined (don't overmix).
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and lightly grease with oil.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake onto the pan.
Cook for 2-3 minutes until bubbles form, then flip and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve warm with honey, berries, or your favorite toppings.

recipes.name: Greek Yogurt Parfait

recipeInfo.description: Layered Greek yogurt parfait with fresh berries and granola. Perfect for a quick breakfast or healthy snack.

cookingSteps: In a bowl, mix Greek yogurt with honey and a pinch of cinnamon.
Wash and prepare mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries).
Chop almonds roughly for added texture.
In serving glasses or bowls, start with a layer of yogurt mixture.
Add a layer of mixed berries on top of the yogurt.
Sprinkle granola and chia seeds over the berries.
Repeat the layers once more: yogurt, berries, granola.
Top with chopped almonds and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.

recipes.name: Energy Balls

recipeInfo.description: No-bake energy balls packed with oats, dates, and nuts. Perfect for a quick energy boost throughout the day.

cookingSteps: Add pitted dates to a food processor and pulse until finely chopped.
Add rolled oats, almond butter, honey, chia seeds, and vanilla extract.
Pulse until the mixture comes together and is sticky.
Fold in chocolate chips by hand.
Roll the mixture into small balls (about 1 tablespoon each).
Place on a lined baking sheet.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to firm up.
Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week.

recipes.name: Apple Slices with Peanut Butter

recipeInfo.description: Classic and simple snack combining crisp apple slices with creamy peanut butter. Great for satisfying hunger between meals.

cookingSteps: Wash the apple thoroughly and pat dry.
Core the apple and slice into 8-10 wedges.
Arrange apple slices on a plate.
In a small bowl, mix peanut butter with honey until smooth.
Sprinkle cinnamon over the peanut butter mixture.
Serve apple slices with the peanut butter dip on the side.
Enjoy immediately for the best taste and texture.

recipes.name: Protein Trail Mix

recipeInfo.description: Homemade trail mix with nuts, seeds, and dried fruits. Perfect portable snack for on-the-go energy.

cookingSteps: In a large bowl, combine almonds, cashews, and pumpkin seeds.
Add dried cranberries and mix well.
Fold in dark chocolate chips and coconut flakes.
Sprinkle a pinch of sea salt over the mixture.
Toss everything together until evenly distributed.
Divide into individual portions or store in an airtight container.
Keep at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.
Enjoy a handful whenever you need a quick energy boost.
